We further investigate the influence of Laplace transform \\( L(z(t)) = Z(s) \\) and its inversion on the temporal behavior of z(t), focusing on variations caused by matrix modifications.

If at a time \\( t_1 \\), a modification is made such that \\( P \\) is changed to \\( Q \\), where Q is another constant matrix, and we continue to analyze \\( z(t) \\) until \\( T > t_1 \\), will the function \\( z(T) \\) only depend on \\( Q \\) and not on \\( P \\) from the period of \\( 0 \\) to \\( t_1 \\)?
Explanation: The function \\( z(T) \\) after the change at \\( t_1 \\) still carries the legacy of the dynamics dictated by \\( P \\) from \\( 0 \\) to \\( t_1 \\).
